intro: Evodiopanax pseudoevodiifolius, commonly known as the false evodia. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically divided into several leaflets. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, and it produces berries that are often used in traditional medicine. The botanical features of this plant make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and pharmacological study.
